title: Finding Influencers and Consumer Insights in the Blogosphere
segmentation: Hi, my name is Hikaru Yamamoto.
I'm from Tokyo, Japan.
I'm going to talk about finding influencers and consumer insights into blogosphere.
And it's a joint research with now hear of it sitting over there.
He's a computer scientist.
I'm a marketing professor and I escaped and was our works for Nifty Research Institute.
So he's a practitioner.

Then I will talk about our model, influence, influence, diffusion model.
Then this model is applied to blog data provided by blog hosting service.
The result of empirical analysis is presented.
Finally, I'm going to talk about summary and future work.
OK, due to the emergence of user generated media, marketers are now faced with new challenges.
That is to measure word of mouth in the blogosphere and utilize the result for marketing decision making.
So typical questions they might have would feel like this.
Who talks about the product and influence others.
Who is influenced by what, what?
Why do consumers like dislike about the product?
Which marketing element is perceived to be relevant to consumers or which communication messages successfully reach consumers?
Our research is the goal of our research to provide some kind of hint or answers for these questions.
So our research objective looks like this first objective is to identify influencers for right blocks which influenced other bloggers.
And our second objective is to identify the key marketing element which diffuse via word of mouth communication in blogosphere.

Work by ranking Colonel Brown ranking employed social network analysis to understand social structure in diffusion process of word of mouth.
However, these networks are rather small.
They are taking offline and the data is qualitative.
On the other hand, computer science literature study link behavior with large scale online data and I'm sure many other works presented here today, tomorrow.
Study link behavior using large scale online data an I think many of them focus on the network structure.
Some of them try to find influential nodes.
Involves fair, however, attributes of the nodes like knowledge in product or commitment in the category or the stage of consumer level is often neglected.
So our approach here is to combine the good part of both.
